private_information: I can inspect and enumerate the initial facts provided in the use-case and identify object identifiers referenced in the plans
I see two separate STATEMENT blocks in the use-case with different initial conditions and goals
observer.goal: Produce a concise structured observation report listing objects, predicates present in the initial states, and the explicit goals from each statement block

private_information: I know the action names and their informal preconditions and effects as described in the use-case
I will convert informal descriptions into structured action schemata (named parameters, required predicates, add effects, delete effects) but I will not emit final PDDL
planner.goal: Produce structured action schemata for each action in the domain that are consistent with the facts and plans in the use-case

private_information: My role is to audit temporal and causal consistency across provided plans and to flag or remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as implicit quota tokens or post-hoc penalties
I will detect leaps where preconditions are satisfied only by transient or inconsistent facts and I will recommend explicit causal links or corrections
auditor.goal: Produce an audit report that identifies temporal or causal inconsistencies in the proposed plans and provide minimal corrective suggestions to make the plan causal and implementable

private_information: I integrate reports from observer, planner, and auditor into a coherent formal PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward solver
I must keep agent actions distinct and preserve agent-level responsibilities while producing a single combined PDDL domain and problem
orchestrator.goal: Produce a final PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownward planner that encodes the actions, initial state, and the selected goal from the use-case

public_information: Available actions: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted
Predicate templates include: hand OBJ, cats OBJ, texture OBJ, vase OBJ OBJ, next OBJ OBJ, sneeze OBJ, stupendous OBJ, collect OBJ OBJ, spring OBJ
Action summaries: To perform paltry requires hand o0 cats o1 texture o2 vase o0 o1 next o1 o2. Paltry adds next o0 o2 and deletes vase o0 o1
To perform sip requires hand o0 cats o1 texture o2 next o0 o2 next o1 o2. Sip adds vase o0 o1 and deletes next o0 o2
To perform clip requires hand o0 sneeze o1 texture o2 next o1 o2 next o0 o2. Clip adds vase o0 o1 and deletes next o0 o2
To perform wretched requires sneeze o0 texture o1 texture o2 stupendous o3 next o0 o1 collect o1 o3 collect o2 o3. Wretched adds next o0 o2 and deletes next o0 o1
To perform memory requires cats o0 spring o1 spring o2 next o0 o1. Memory adds next o0 o2 and deletes next o0 o1
To perform tightfisted requires hand o0 sneeze o1 texture o2 next o1 o2 vase o0 o1. Tightfisted adds next o0 o2 and deletes vase o0 o1

STATEMENT block A goal: next object_12 object_10 and next object_13 object_9

STATEMENT block A plan is provided as a sequence of grounded actions involving objects such as object_12, object_13, object_5, object_11, object_10, object_4, object_7, object_6, object_1, object_9 and others

STATEMENT block B initial facts include cats object_0 collect object_10 object_2 collect object_5 object_1 collect object_6 object_1 collect object_7 object_1 collect object_8 object_2 collect object_9 object_2 hand object_11 hand object_12 hand object_13 next object_0 object_8 next object_11 object_10 next object_12 object_6 next object_13 object_9 next object_3 object_7 next object_4 object_10 sneeze object_3 sneeze object_4 spring object_5 spring object_8 stupendous object_1 stupendous object_2 texture object_10 texture object_5 texture object_6 texture object_7 texture object_8 texture object_9
STATEMENT block B goal: next object_11 object_8 next object_12 object_8 next object_13 object_10
Two statement blocks present alternate tasks; orchestrator must choose which statement block to formalize or produce separate PDDL problems for each

observe.system_prompt: You are an observer that inspects the provided use-case and enumerates concrete initial facts, object identifiers, and which statement block each fact belongs to. Produce a compact structured report in JSON listing objects, predicates and the explicit goals seen. Do not emit PDDL.
observe.prompt: Your identity is observer. Use the following public information: {environment->public_information} Use your private information: {agents->observer->private_information} Your goal: {agents->observer->goal} Produce a concise structured observation report that will be consumed by downstream agents. The report should list the two statement blocks separately, list objects mentioned, list initial true predicates for each block, and repeat the stated goals. Output only machine-parsable JSON content in your response.

analyze.system_prompt: You are a planning specialist. Translate the informal action descriptions into structured action schemata. For each action define parameter names, preconditions, add effects and delete effects in a structured JSON format. Do not emit final PDDL. Keep actions distinct and keep parameter variable names consistent across schemata.
analyze.prompt: Your identity is planner. Use the following public information: {environment->public_information} Use the observer report: {obs_report} Use your private information: {agents->planner->private_information} Your goal: {agents->planner->goal} Produce structured action schemata for paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory and tightfisted. For each schema provide parameter list, preconditions as a list of predicate tuples, add effects as a list, and delete effects as a list. Make any necessary clarifying questions explicit if information is missing.

audit.system_prompt: You are an auditor whose job is to check temporal and causal consistency. Identify where a proposed plan or action sequence relies on bookkeeping shortcuts or transient facts that are not guaranteed. Provide concrete recommendations to remove such shortcuts, for example by adding explicit causal steps or making effects persistent. Produce a structured audit report and minimal corrective suggestions. Do not emit PDDL.
audit.prompt: Your identity is auditor. Use the following public information: {environment->public_information} Use the observer report: {obs_report} Use the planner report: {planner_report} Use your private information: {agents->auditor->private_information} Your goal: {agents->auditor->goal} Produce an audit report that lists potential temporal inconsistencies, missing causal links, or implicit assumptions in the plans. For each issue propose small corrective steps that the orchestrator can incorporate into the PDDL encoding.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems targeting the FastDownward solver. Using the inputs you must produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file compatible with FastDownward. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep agent actions distinct when relevant. Integrate auditor corrections to ensure causal and temporal soundness.
pddl.prompt: Your identity is orchestrator. You will receive reports from observer, planner, and auditor: {obs_report} {planner_report} {audit_report} Use the public information: {environment->public_information} Use your private information: {agents->orchestrator->private_information} Your goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Integrate the structured action schemata, observed initial facts, and audit corrections. Provide a final PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode one selectable task from the statement blocks or produce two separate PDDL problems, one for each statement block. Ensure the resulting PDDL is compatible with FastDownward conventions. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>.
